website_summaries.verdict: The CalDigit Tuff is an excellent portable drive if you need a fast external storage device to use in rough, dirty or wet environments.
pros: The CalDigit Tuff portable drive is superfast and durable
It includes cables for both USB-C and regular USB ports
cons: The SSD version caps at just 1TB and Windows users will need to reformat before use

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a MacBook Pro running macOS Sierra to back up my entire computer. It's so easy to use, just plug it in and let Time Machine back up to the hard drive. I haven't had to recover anything yet, but all indications are that it would work if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Genemark

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, Reliable, Effortless to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the CalDigit to replace my elderly and failing LaCie as the Time Machine backup for my iMac, which has the older type USB connectors. It required no setup—it just worked. The most pleasant part of this new unit is how quiet it is. The LaCie made a nearly continuous rattle that was driving me nuts. The only sound the CalDigit make is a tiny "gleep" on occasion. It's so faint that it took me a while to figure out where it was coming from. Very pleased with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pemburn

customer_reviews.title: Can be reformatted for Win with some work (Linux easily)
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of work to reformat this for Windows, but once done, appears to work great (fast and large capacity) and will hold a lot of field information while it may get knocked around a bit. Hope it is as tough as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: This drive works great. it is well built and i trust it ...
customer_reviews.text: I an a huge fan of Caldigit products. Been using them for over 10 years now. This drive works great. it is well built and i trust it will hold up like the rest of their line.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: First time to purchase this brand. Easy to copy folders from old external drive.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but NOT THUNDERBOLT COMPATIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought five or six of these to backup my photos and videos, they work fine without a problem and so far, over about a year, I have not had any problems. I bought a Lacie and a G Force which both ceased working in different ways after purchase. So far these are the best BUT are NOT THUNDERBOLT! I have tried multiple ones on two different Macs, one from 2014 and one from 2018 and they simply do not recognize these devices.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great with previous generation MAC Book Pro (not the USBC version).
customer_reviews.text: Works great with previous generation MAC Book Pro (not the USBC version). I just plugged it in and it work.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 star - haven't dropped it yet
customer_reviews.text: Seems very good. Dissapates heat well. Works well with OSX. But we warned ONLY USB C plug. I know this won't matter in a few years when C becomes the norm - but for the price - I think it should have a B option. If you need to pass files to another person with older or PC laptop. Or you have a crisis and need to access files from a hotel PC or such.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Green

customer_reviews.title: PC doesn't recognize the hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't format the Tuff hard drive because either of my two PC computers can't recognize the drive. Unfortunately, I will have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is fast. I do not store any photos or video on my laptop so everything I shoot is on an external. I have no lag watching and editing 4K videos straight from this drive. If you are looking for usb-c this is defiantly the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Read and pay attention
customer_reviews.text: Very good unit, works fine out of the box for MACs, the only problem is it drains your battery power from your laptop if you lease it connected, so much for using this as a increase to your storage and use data needs. I mean it drains the battery quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Betka

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, Portable, External Harddrive, Especially for Mac’s
customer_reviews.text: Works out of the box with a MacPro. Includes older style USB connector that I need. Rugged appearance. Quiet. Seems like a great choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Glidden

customer_reviews.title: A couple upgrades for the future
customer_reviews.text: It does not appear to support encryption or password protection. These are not deal breakers, but I didn’t see these listed in the description. I like the silicone cover, keeps it from slipping and sliding.
customer_reviews.author: mrcrankeee

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to replace in 2 years or less...
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 1 TB drives and used daily. They worked fine until just over 2 years of use...both died within a few days of one another. Drives don't last forever...but this is definitely the short end of a drive's life span. For the price, they should have lasted longer. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very good for transferring and storing large gigabyte files from my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good for transferring and storing large gigabyte files from my sd cards using my MacBook Pro! I especially like the USB-C connection so I don't have to use a dongle to plug it in. Wish it came with a longer cord ....but I would still highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marc H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Modern looking external drive--comes with usb-c cord for new MacBook.
customer_reviews.author: Jack S Genicoff

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value with USB 3.1 2nd gen. The protective cover is somewhat loose. But that is not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: MULUGETA AKALU

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, ease of use for the user, quiet, and small in size. Very impressed !!

customer_reviews.title: Not a thunderbolt drive.
customer_reviews.text: This is an overpriced USB drive despite the fact that Caldigit says "Thunderbolt3" all over their product description. Of course it's Thunderbolt "COMPATIBLE" ... deceptive marketing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - ready to go for a Mac

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I like the package, the tough look and feel, it is a quiet heavy hard drive that feels really robust. Copying files and videos on it is amazingly fast. Love it

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Easy to use and very fast
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to use and very fast. Really like the plastic case to hold the hard and USB cables.

customer_reviews.title: CalDigit Tuff
customer_reviews.text: It is set up for a MAC computer. If you have use Windows you have to reformat it. The instructions are in the box, but it is not the same set up as my computer so I have not been able to reformat it yet to use. I like how heavy duty it is - I am hoping to use it for what it is and not just a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this hard drive!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in 8 months ago and it has already corrupted on me. I have lost an enormous amount of files and the repair guy that I took it to to help me said this company has a bad reputation and I was probably sent a defective drive. DO NOT BUY!!!!
